contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox protected area | name = Cévennes National Park | alt_name = Parc national des Cévennes | iucn_category = II | photo = Cevennes_Florac_Mimente_depuis_Causse_Mejean.jpg | photo_alt = | photo_caption = Florac and of the Cévennes National Park seen from Causse Méjean | photo_width = | map = | map_alt = | map_caption = | map_width = | location = | nearest_city = | lat_d = 44 | lat_m = 11 | lat_s = 38 | lat_NS = N | long_d = 3 | long_m = 34 | long_s = 53 | long_EW = E | coords = | coords_ref = | region = | area = | established = 1970 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | governing_body = | world_heritage_site = | url = http://www.cevennes-parcnational.fr/ }} The '''Cévennes National Park''' ({{lang-fr|Parc national des Cévennes}}) is a [[national park]] located in southern [[France]], in the mountainous area of [[Cévennes]]. Created in 1970, the park has its administrative seat in [[Florac]] at [[Florac Castle]]. It is located mainly in the ''[[département in France|départements]]'' of [[Lozère]] and [[Gard]], and covers some parts of [[Ardèche]] and [[Aveyron]]. The [[Aven Armand]] cave is located in the park. == Geography == The park includes several mountains and plateaus, including: [[Mont Lozère]], [[Mont Aigoual]], [[Causse Méjean]], [[France]]. Mont Lozère is the highest peak in the area, reaching 1,699 metres. == History == The Cévennes country is rich of history, with a strong cultural identity, being at the heart of [[Camisard]] revolt, which followed the revocation of the [[Edict of Nantes]] (the [[Edict of Fontainebleau]]), after which Protestants were actively prosecuted.<ref>Antoine Court de Gébelin (2009), ''Histoire des troubles des Cévennes ou de la guerre des camisards sous le règne de Louis le Grand'', reprint of the original text published in 1760. Editions Lacour-Ollé, Nîmes (in French)[http://books.google.com/books/about/Histoire_des_troubles_des_C%C3%A9vennes.html?id=XzpN2ogA1RkC]</ref> Numerous testimonies of [[Camisard]] war in the Cévennes abund in towns and villages of the Cévennes National Park. A project of a permanent exhibition devoted to the memory of [[Camisard]]s has been elaborated at the old temple of Le Rouve (commune of [[Saint-André-de-Lancize]]).<ref>[http://templedurouve-english.asso-web.com The first Camisards and freedom of conscience].</ref>[[File:Temple du Rouve.jpeg|thumb|The temple of Rouve Bas: today disused, it is at the heart of a project devoted to the memory of Camisard war in Bougès mountains (Cévennes)]] == Points of interest == * [[Arboretum de Cazebonne]] * [[Aven Armand]] == See also == * [[List of national parks of France]] * ''[[Travels with a Donkey in the Cévennes]]'' (1879) by [[Robert Louis Stevenson]] == External links == * [http://www.cevennes-parcnational.fr/ Official Site] (English, French) * [http://les.cevennes.free.fr The Cevennes National Park] (English, French, Dutch & German) * http://www.bsi.fr/pnc/{{Dead link|date=November 2010}} (in French) * [http://www.regordane.info Regordane Info - The independent portal for The Regordane Way or St Gilles Trail.
